title: 既要增长又要品牌，Airbnb在中国市场做了什么？

description: <p>编者按：本文来自<a href="https://new.qq.com/cmsn/20180923/20180923007725.html" target="_blank">腾讯科技</a>；36氪经授权转载。</p><p>9月23日消息，诺贝尔物理学奖得主、香港中文大学前校长高锟逝世，享年84岁。香港中文大学发文敬悼：敬悼中大前校长及光纤之父高锟教授。</p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24013702/y58k45r6k8j5d13j.jpeg!heading" data-img-size-val="678,536" width="678"/></p><p>一、高锟生平</p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24013821/lyawqlkum010jvk7!heading" data-img-size-val="500,328"/></p><p>　　出生于上海书香门第</p><p>　　1933年11月4日，高锟出生在上海金山的书香门第，住在法租界，父亲用一把宝剑的名字为其取名。</p><p>　　祖父高吹万，乃清末民初著名爱国诗人。其父高君湘是律师，家境优渥，但家教甚严。</p><p>　　高锟幼时便受到国学启蒙。扎实的国学基础，对其一生产生了深远影响。</p><p>　　远赴英国求学</p><p>　　15岁时，高锟举家迁往香港。次年，高锟进入圣若瑟书院就读，中学毕业后考入香港大学，后远赴英国格林威治大学就读。</p><p>　　1957年，高锟从伍尔维奇理工学院电子工程专业毕业。</p><p>　　1965年，高锟在伦敦大学下属的伦敦大学学院获得电机工程博士学位。</p><p>　　工作期间提出的理论初时未获认同</p><p>　　1957年，高锟读博士时进入国际电话电报公司，在其英国子公司-标准电话与电缆有限公司（Standard Telephones and Cables Ltd.）任工程师。</p><p>　　1970年，高锟加入香港中文大学，筹办电子学系，并担任系主任；1987-1996年任香港中文大学第三任校长；1996年当选为中国科学院外籍院士；2000年被《亚洲新闻周刊》选为“二十世纪亚洲风云人物”。</p><p>　　但他未有放弃，继续研究及改良技术，至1981年第一代光纤系统面世，他亦因此获得“光纤之父”美誉。</p><p>　　在1987年，高锟回港出任中文大学第三任校长，期间创立讯息工程学系，直至1996年退休。</p><p>　　2003年初，高锟被证实患上阿兹海默病，此后，为帮助阿兹海默症患者，高锟与其夫人成立了高锟慈善基金。</p><p>　　2009年，在提出光纤通讯后四十多年，高锟获得诺贝尔物理学奖。</p><p>　　2018年9月23日，高锟病逝于香港，终年84岁。</p><p>　　二、高锟的主要贡献</p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24013821/qep4zxj4zuqbrzt9!heading" data-img-size-val="945,709"/></p><p>　　迟来的诺贝尔物理学奖</p><p>　　高锟在国际电话电报公司任职期间，即从事光导纤维在通讯领域运用的研究。</p><p>　　1964年，他提出在电话网络中以光代替电流，以玻璃纤维代替导线。</p><p>　　1965年，在以无数实验为基础的一篇论文中提出以石英基玻璃纤维作长程信息传递，将带来一场通讯业的革命，并提出当玻璃纤维损耗率下降到20分贝/公里时，光纤维通讯就会成功。</p><p>　　1966年，在标准电话实验室与何克汉共同提出光纤可以用作通信媒介。</p><p>　　高锟在电磁波导、陶瓷科学（包括光纤制造）方面获28项专利。由于他取得的成果，有超过10亿公里的光缆以闪电般的速度通过宽带互联网，为全球各地的办事处和家居提供数据。</p><p>　　基于研究利用玻璃纤维传送讯号的知识，高锟于1966年发表了一篇题为《光频率介质纤维表面波导》的论文，提出利用石英基玻璃纤维，可进行长距离及高讯息量的讯息传送。</p><p>　　简单地说，只要解决好玻璃纯度和成分等问题，就能够利用玻璃制作光学纤维，从而高效传输信息。</p><p>　　高锟的理论初时未获认同，更有媒体嘲笑他“痴人说梦”。</p><p>　　但在争论中，高锟的设想逐步变成现实：利用石英玻璃制成的光纤应用越来越广泛，全世界掀起了一场光纤通信的革命。</p><p>　　1971年，世界上第一条1公里长的光纤问世，第一个光纤通讯系统也在1981年启用。高锟“光纤之父”美誉传遍世界。</p><p>　　高锟还开发了实现光纤通讯所需的辅助性子系统。他在单模纤维的构造、纤维的强度和耐久性、纤维连接器和耦合器以及扩散均衡特性等多个领域都作了大量的研究，而这些研究成果都是使信号在无放大的条件下，以每秒亿兆位元传送至距离以万米为单位的成功关键。</p><p>　　2009年，高锟首次提出光纤通讯后四十多年，终获得诺贝尔物理学奖，诺贝尔委员会赞扬他“在纤维中传送光以达成光学通讯的开拓成就（for groundbreaking achievements concerning the transmission of light in fibers for optical communication）”。</p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24013821/t9j81xlovca3waw8!heading" data-img-size-val="557,343"/></p><p>　　这是一份迟来的荣誉，高锟在科学上的贡献已经远远超越了时代的局限，让世界能够更快进入到信息爆发的时代。而现在谈起“光纤之父”的称号，高锟博士也并不在意。</p><p>　　2010年，高锟先后获得“影响世界华人大奖”，以及英女王寿辰“爵士勋衔”及香港“大紫荆勋章”。</p><p>　　三、高锟其人</p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24013821/biv4p2d9ng6i1l1q!heading" data-img-size-val="640,808"/></p><p>　　高锟在香港中文大学任职期间，有时会受到同学们的恶作剧捉弄，这点从其学生梁文道的《我的老校长高锟》一文中，也可略知一二。</p><p>　　梁文道曾回忆称他当年在念书的时候，学生们都认为高锟只是个糟老头，并没有多么厉害。梁文道的一个同学是那时学生报的编辑，赶在高锟退休之前，在报上发了一篇文章，总结他的政绩，标题里有一句“八年校长一事无成”，大家看了都拍手叫好。</p><p>　　同学们对高锟做的恶作剧，高锟也只是笑笑，并不惩罚。</p><p>　　毕业之后，梁文道才从当年干过学生会和学生报的老同学那里得知，原来高锟每年都会亲笔写信给他们，感谢他们的工作。</p><p>　　而且每年都会自掏腰包，私下捐给这两个组织各两万港币的补助金，请他们自行分配给家境比较困难的同学。</p><p>　　美国总统奥巴马曾评价其：你的研究完全改变了世界，促进了美国及世界经济的发展，我本人为你而感到骄傲，世界欠你一个极大人情。</p><p>　　喧嚣之中他是唯一的平静</p><p>　　在获诺奖之前，高锟陆续得到过15项国际大奖，其中包括瑞典爱立信国际奖以及日本诺贝尔奖。直到他的研究问世43年后，人们终于记起他的成就，诺贝尔物理学奖到来时，他自己，却记不得了。</p><p>　　通知高锟获得诺贝尔物理学奖的当天，他正从老人健康中心回到家，高锟顺从地听着太太黄美芸的“指挥”，换鞋、喝牛奶、吃蛋糕、穿马甲。他的眼睛总不愿意离开黄美芸，他喜欢冲着她笑，她是他自传中第一章“邂逅”的主人公，也是他眼下唯一叫得出名字的人。</p><p>　　“电视里在播诺贝尔奖，那是给你的。”在美国的家里，黄美芸告诉高锟。</p><p>　　“给我的？哦……挺好的。”这位华裔科学家面无表情地说。</p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24013821/lgm3stw0rpzssfcj!heading" data-img-size-val="400,265"/></p><p>　　事实上，76岁的高锟早在5年前就已患上了阿尔茨海默氏症（老年痴呆）。这几年，除了几条简短的消息偶尔透露一下他的病情外，这位被誉为“光纤之父”的老人几乎淡出了人们的视野。每天，他只是和妻子打网球，去健康中心和其他老人一起运动手脚。</p><p>　　随着病情的发展，高锟的记忆力、表达能力逐渐下降，平时的言谈举止像小孩一样。帮黄美芸洗完菜后，他会扭头向妻子邀功：“你看，我做好了。”而黄美芸也笑着鼓励他：“做得不错”。</p><p>　　一片喧嚣之中，只有高锟本人是平静的。面对不同媒体的镜头，高锟总是穿着一件红色的线衫，浅浅地微笑着。“我实在不是一个太有趣的人，没有什么大喜大悲，一直以来都太过平稳。”他曾这样总结自己。</p>
title: 一文读懂高锟：从痴人说梦到光纤之父

description: <p>编者按：本文来自微信公众号“<a href="https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/hF7IgVSgTB042fwfJ4iiGg" target="_blank">一起拍电影</a>”（ID：yiqipaidianying），作者吕世明。36氪经授权转载。</p><p>一家臃肿的影视公司有多麻烦，几个做不出项目的制片人，几十个只会混日子的发行，某某部门经理的亲戚孩子。这样的配置，怎么可能做的出赚钱的项目？！</p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24030621/4xdfx2siirrqnmal!heading" data-img-size-val="500,281"/></p><p>“光线最喜欢裁员，万达、华谊的人员流动性最大，其他影视公司也同样在这两年面临较频繁的人员变动，电影圈的日子越来越不好过了“一位业内朋友和一起拍电影（ID：yiqipaidianying）这样表示道。</p><p>影视公司还相信“末位淘汰机制”吗？</p><p>影视行业面临寒冬已经是不争的事实，2015年内地电影市场的泡沫达到了顶点，2016年市场的拐点和2017年的阶段性调整以及今年收到政策面和大环境的影响，影视圈的瘦身成为了大趋势。</p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24030621/00u22e1fusqm3sgu!heading" data-img-size-val="500,281"/></p><p>裁员，几乎是目前影视行业的所有人都要去面临的问题。没人项目可能无法操作，留人未必有助于项目实施，大环境下的裁员潮也波及到影视圈。</p><p>裁掉囊肿还是留存苟然，这已经是摆到很多影视公司面前非常紧迫的问题了，但对于大部分伺机而动蛰伏待发的影视公司而言，裁不裁的确是非常难抉择的问题。</p><p>寒冬最先冻死的不是穿的少的人，而是没有寒冬意识，毫无准备，仍然在盲目扩张的人。</p><p>但必须要坦诚和大家说一下：裁掉一成员工，你距离下一个头部公司只有一步之遥。</p><address><p>影视公司最容易养闲人，</p><p>寒冬下，一定要提前制定“瘦身计划”！</p></address><p>“这一波裁员大潮其实是从2016年开始，那阵子保底不断失败，一整年也没有出现像2015年那样的爆款，实在不景气。去年情况其实好一点，但今年大环境不好，游戏、互联网均有大幅度裁员，影视公司裁员可能是这两年较频繁的。”</p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24030621/vm7yioq7cmvaragr!heading" data-img-size-val="1080,810"/></p><p>一位院线的朋友和拍Sir透露，因不断的行业内外震荡，影视业的裁员风潮一直都高于其他行业。为什么呢？很简单，其他行业虽然看起来了利润率不高，这反而使得这些行业风险性较低，大家也可以用维持的心态做企业，即便有裁员也是小范围内来执行。而影视公司看似利润率高，但相应的，几个项目不赚钱，马上会很难继续。我们也说过，｛<a href="https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s?__biz=MzA3MjI5NDgzMQ==&mid=2650925265&idx=1&sn=299b56b167630adc1159e1637044c414&scene=21#wechat_redirect">每个公司都养着三个做不出项目的制片人</a>｝｛<a href="https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s?__biz=MzA3MjI5NDgzMQ==&mid=2650926677&idx=2&sn=9145b378686856b2a2f94e9df86585eb&scene=21#wechat_redirect">每个公司至少有几十个推不动的ppt项目</a>｝。</p><p>目前的状况是：受到贸易战、关税、物价油价房价等因素的多重影响，泡沫性质最大的游戏、互联网和影视首当其冲，被波及的范围最大，比起其他刚需更强的行业而言，可支配收入的降低也会使得这些行业前景更为暗淡。</p><p>更早之前，当亚洲金融风暴引发，直接导致了整个东亚经济圈房地产业的大幅度震荡，同时在2001年当纳斯达克互联网泡沫碎掉之后，一大批互联网公司未能挺过寒潮直接倒闭。</p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24030621/08i6lkelbp8soyv0!heading" data-img-size-val="1080,720"/></p><p>也是这样，当2008年，金融风暴再一次吹起，百度以及阿里再次阶段均瘦身成功，继而躲过灾难，成为了目前国际化的互联网公司，可见的在大环境的不利好状态下，实施瘦身计划往往会让企业获得在未来重新翻盘的机会。</p><p>所以，奉劝大家一句。影视公司，一定要提前制定瘦身计划！</p><p>环境不好，经营不善，不用说大企业和大公司，即便是中小企事业也懂得“开除”点人来维持经营状况，在等待机会东山再起。但事实上，大部分中小企业如果抱着开除人来节省费用的思维来经营，往往反而把企业做得越来越惨，甚至最终穷途末路，裁员其实本质上和开除人是两回事。</p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24030621/kqr6o9i6i1lkxd5q!heading" data-img-size-val="492,275"/></p><p>2016-17年暑期，国内当代东方、光线、中影、幸福蓝海等均有人员变更的状况出现，同时在好莱坞，最近十余年则出现了几乎所有顶级制片发行公司的全面CEO大换血，一朝天子一朝臣，主要负责人的更迭往往会有极强的连带效果，会造成企事业的大面积裁员举动。</p><p>东方传奇、东方梦工厂和这两年大面积的裁员和人员的变动似乎给这两家公司蒙上了阴影，IMAX即便在内地发展势头迅猛，依然也有大范围的人员裁撤举动。</p><p>不过好莱坞的情况和内地并不完全相同，这些公司具有更长期的项目规划策略，对于他们而言，裁员计划更像冬眠策略。同样，国内虽然不能完全来照搬好莱坞影视公司裁员策略，但瘦身和长期策略的制定仍然是最行之有效的。</p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24030621/25g5aykl0p1a1qi6!heading" data-img-size-val="1080,715"/></p><p>在整体大环境不理想的前提下，影视公司也势必需要根据情况来裁掉臃肿的组织。</p><address><p>裁员不是“保命”走形式，</p><p>裁人的最终目的是激励机制</p></address><p>根据业内朋友的透露：影视公司中光线裁人的频率是最高的。从2015年开始，每年光线均要保持10%的裁员频次，同时光线也有较高的招聘入职机会，因光线影业最初是传媒起家，整体的运行理念和思维也趋向兼顾企业的年轻化和新鲜血液的培养。</p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24030621/ya48r46wltoheeoh!heading" data-img-size-val="1080,645"/></p><p>目前光线影业部门最初一批人员也都流转到了其他影视公司，和万达、华谊一样，较早涉足到影视行业的这些公司人员的流动也助力目前内地影视的均衡发展，一般影视公司的自动离职和裁员的比例几乎是等同的，这样看来裁员和离职对于行业发展而言是必不可少的。</p><p>其实无论是管理者、员工和行业外人员，大家是比较抵触裁员的，管理者自然希望企业规模越来越大，人员越来越多；员工也希望可以在一家有前途的公司长期做下去；在行业外人士看起来，企业自身的稳定和人员的固定，是企业本身健康发展的主要因素，也是投资者和股东所看重的。</p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24030621/nxj3mxwmjonmcykp!heading" data-img-size-val="600,337"/></p><p>事实上目前大部分影视公司仍然比较器重亲信，这也使得很多民营公司存在任人唯亲的状况，只不过美化成”举贤不避亲仇”。不过不同于在仕途经济上任用人次的思路，对于商品经济、市场机制，我们要对人才的使用和任免更多以科学的方式来裁定。</p><p>这样看来，内地大部分影视公司中存在了很多高层管理人员的“闲人”。</p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24030621/e944gxuxwmqpucjs!heading" data-img-size-val="1080,675"/></p><p>同样，大部分新晋入职不足一年的员工也会在此周期内体现出个人的工作的能力和水平，相当于木桶效益，他们的长短往往从另外一个侧面会影响到公司的业务水平。</p><p>但并不是说要立即拿底层员工开刀和裁员，人员的流动和新鲜血液的补偿是这部分员工对于影视公司人员构成所必须的，事实也证明，大部分刚刚入职的青年人，他们的流动性最强。无论是自主离职，还是裁员往往更容易找到他们。</p><p>高层的闲人没必要顾忌面子留存，他们的存在会极大影响到公司内部人心的凝聚力，底层人员对于公司而言，则是考察和培养的目标，其实他们对于裁员和离职的态度更为豁达，毕竟对于她们而言，也期望自己有更多元化的选择和发展。</p><address><p>寒冬下，抓住机会！</p><p>裁掉一成员工，轻装上阵，</p><p>努力向头部公司进击吧！</p></address><p>养过猫狗等宠物的人都会知道一个状况，如果你的宠物没有做过节育手术和下过幼崽，这样的宠物特别容易患体内的囊肿。这一状况对于大部分哺乳动物都会存在，只不过宠物和人往往会存在人为控制的不怀孕行为。</p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24030622/9ddse6qmv7wwqzao!heading" data-img-size-val="1080,720"/></p><p>也就是说明，如果缺乏较好的疏通机制，一个机体内部特别容易产生病变和囊肿，人和动物是如此，一个企业也同样会存在这样的问题。</p><p>而也在更加恶劣的环境下，对于臃肿的公司来说，要做的是“冬眠”“平稳落地”，但对一些优质的公司的来说，是时候抓住眼下的机会，轻装上阵，“务实”地向头部发起冲击。</p><p>这里仍然以“最喜欢”裁员的光线为例，从2015年开始，光线便不断裁员，每年暑期均有10-15%的裁员计划，但同样这几年光线的人员重新补充也有20%左右的增长。</p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24030622/8l835rixpb5iomht!heading" data-img-size-val="900,381"/></p><p>这一里一外，光线则完成了极好的人员新鲜度的保持、同时其他新兴影视公司也对像光线和其他老牌民营影视公司裁员和离职的员工有较高的兴趣和采纳愿望，毕竟多年的人脉累积和经验是这些公司所看重的。</p><p>那么对于光线和大部分有愿望裁员的公司而言，企业内部策略的调整也是裁员的动力主要动力，像之前所指定的策略需要配备相应的人员，但伴随市场状况的调整，这部分之前配备的人员会存在“专业性”极强，但不适应到其他部门，这部分人员裁撤是企业在应对市场变化所必须执行的。</p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24030621/e944gxuxwmqpucjs!heading" data-img-size-val="1080,675"/></p><p>同样，目前内地绝大多数影视公司，他们的发展方向已经逐步趋于明朗，有计划、有愿望安排人员配置也都在近一两年内逐步落实，摈弃掉多余的员工，裁撤掉多一成的人员，对于企业更长时间的发展无疑是利好的。</p><p>国内成功的头部影视公司，其采取的裁员方式并没有直接砍掉任何单一的部门，即便在这两年受到互联网和线上售票的强烈冲击，几乎鲜有内地影视公司贸然砍掉发行部门，但人员的精简的确存在。</p><p>之前一些地面发行团队甚至会有单个城市四五人的配置，但目前大都会维持到1-2人的组成，也达到了人员配置的极度精简化。</p><p>事实也证明，以近两年取得成功的内地头部影视公司来看，像聚合影联、华影天下、光线影业、博纳和万达等，均维系了比较稳定的中层管理人员配置，主要的负责人虽然也有人员的更迭变化，但整体仍然保持比较健康合理的状态。</p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24030622/9adchvg93qf32zxx!heading" data-img-size-val="492,270"/></p><p>裁员的最终方向是对人员配置的重新合理化组合，他和以往我们所认为的“开源节流”并不相同，对于人才的了解、培养和储备也是未来内地影视公司长途发展的主要努力方向。</p><p>从业者一定要坚信：寒冬过后，即是春天。</p><p>把不专业、不务实的公司和从业者洗牌出这个行业，把新鲜的、需要更多机会的人容纳近自己的体系。抓住机会，向头部公司发起冲击吧！</p>
title: 为什么越头部的影视公司，越重视裁员换血？

description: <p>9月23日晚，中国恒大（0333）在香港交易所发布公告称，恒大集团以接近145亿元的资本入股广汇集团，成为第二大股东。<span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">这是恒大继6月入股FF（法拉第未来）以来</span><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">再次押注汽车领域。</span></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">公告显示，恒大集团与广汇集团于2018年9月21日签订战略合作协议，双方同意在汽车销售、能源、地产、物流等领域开展合作。</span><br/></p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24052729/p1b63145q5imfwxq!heading" data-img-size-val="1165,996"/></p><p label="图片描述" classname="img-desc" class="img-desc">中国恒大发布的公告<span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;"></span></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">公告披露，自投资协议书签署日起7个工作日内，促成除广汇控股股东以外的现有广汇集团股东向恒大集团转让广汇集团合计23.865%股权，代价为人民币66.8亿元。同时，恒大集团对广汇集团增资78.1亿元，增资完成后，恒大集团将持有广汇集团合共40.964%股权，成为广汇集团第二大股东。</span><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">本次交易的总代价为人民币144.9亿元，由恒大集团以分期方式支付。</span></p><p>公开信息显示，广汇集团创立于1989年，主要从事能源、汽车销售、物流及房地产等业务。2002年，<span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">母公司广汇集团进入汽车经销服务行业，至今</span><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">广汇汽车成为中国最大的融资租赁提供商及二手车交易代理商，</span><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">截止2017年12月31日，公司建立了覆盖28个省、自治区及直辖市的全国性汽车经销网络，共运营800个营业网点，包括737家4S店，并</span><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">为57个乘用车品牌提供经销服务。</span></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">恒大在汽车领域的布局也不断见长。就在今年6月底，恒大方面刚刚完成了对美国新能源汽车公司Faraday Future（简称FF）的收购。集团旗下的恒大健康以67.47亿港元收购香港时颖公司100%股权，间接获得Smart King公司45%的股权，成为公司第一大股东。</span></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">今年8月7日，恒大法拉第未来中国总部成立，8月14日，恒大法拉第未来智能汽车（中国）集团在广州恒大中心正式揭牌。</span></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">对于此次进行股权投资事项的原因，中国恒大方面表示是为了推动公司在汽车销售、能源、地产及物流等领域的发展。诚然，恒大法拉第主要是新能源汽车的研发与制造，而在广汇集团上的入股布局，极有可能是解决未来多品类汽车产品的渠道、销售、服务等后续问题。</span></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">根据恒大法拉第未来的十年战略规划，恒大法拉第计划十年后年产能计划达到500万辆，FF91、FF81等多系列多车型产品面向全球市场，覆盖高端、中端及入门级，入股广汇集团可能是其为打开汽车领域销路的第一步，此后，汽车也将成为恒大除了足球、地产外的又一重点布局。</span></p><p><br/></p><p><br/></p>

SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">比如孟加拉国——人口非常密集（拥有1.6亿人口），但基础设施却不尽如人意。</span><strong><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">打车服务</span><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">平台 Shohoz近日获得了1500万美元融资，领投方为最近完成1亿美元募资的新加坡基金&nbsp;Golden Gate Ventures。</span><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;"></span><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;"></span><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;"></span></strong><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">此外中国线性资本、500 Startups以及新加坡天使投资人 Koh Boon Hwee也参与了本轮融资。</span></p><p>孟加拉国的出行战场并非只有Shohoz一家。除了Uber的身影，Shohoz的当地竞争对手Pathao已经得到了Go-Jek的支持，并于最近宣布完成1000万美元融资。结束本轮1500万美元融资后，Shohoz起码在融资进度上和对手拉平。</p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24091233/r8bugqpblw5s7w86.jpg!heading" data-img-size-val="1390,741"/></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">Shohoz在孟加拉语中的意思是“简单”——试图通过共享出行的方式，简化人们的生活。以首都达卡为例，达卡拥有超过1800万人口，交通工具选择却十分有限。人口密集、交通选择受限，这两个条件是共享出行服务天然的土壤。</span></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">创立于2014年，Shohoz最早在线上销售公交车票，此后增加了其它车票选项（比如轮渡）。</span></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">从今年1月份起，这家公司开始逐步提供按需服务，增加了摩托车，并于最近推出了私家车服务。</span><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">CEO Maliha Quadir表示，<strong>目前每月能够完成100万辆车的注册</strong>。公交车票仍然是公司业务的重要组成部分，将会和</span><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">“共享出行”产生协同效应。</span></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">Quadir毕业于哈佛大学并曾在美国和新加坡从事金融工作。她表示，Shohoz将通过本轮融资，实现共享出行业务的双倍增长。尤其是，这项计划将很快复制到达卡以外的城市。</span></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;"></span></p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24091245/q3szbof0podgkukg.png!heading" data-img-size-val="680,401"/></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">Shohoz更大的野心在于，以Go-Jek、Grab两个东南亚独角兽的风格加入到“超级应用”中来。</span></p><p>这意味着Shohoz提供的服务将不仅限于打车。其服务范围将超越点对点运输，最初或包括外卖配送，同时也有计划增加按需服务。类似于Go-Jek，<span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">提供杂货、美发、按摩等按需服务。最终Quadir还计划增加金融服务，不排除将来支付场景和金融产品也会叠加进来。</span></p><p><strong>东南亚的“超级应用”们已经开始扩张到本地市场以外，但<span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">Shohoz表示暂未打算进入国际市场。</span></strong><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">“这是我的想法”，Quadir表示，在孟加拉国还有很多工作要做，这是一个尚未被开垦的地方。</span></p><p><span style="font-family: description: <html><head></head><body><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>When Search first began, our results were just plain text. But on February 24, 2000, something changed. It was the day after the Grammy Awards, and we noticed people were searching like crazy for <a href="https://www.google.com/search?q=jennifer+lopez+green+dress&amp;source=lnms&amp;tbm=isch&amp;sa=X&amp;ved=0ahUKEwjIqOud6dHdAhUmHDQIHfqMDToQ_AUIDigB&amp;biw=1428&amp;bih=687">Jennifer Lopez’s green dress</a>. It was clear right away that people were looking for visual information, not just plain text. In the years that followed, the growth of mobile devices and small screens made it even more important to be able to quickly scan visual results.</p><p>Since then, we’ve been working to include more imagery and videos in Search, whether it’s illustrated weather reports, live sports clips, or our visual recipe experience. We've been able to do this in part thanks to advancements in computer vision, which help us extract concepts from images. We model hundreds of millions of fine-grained concepts for every image and video that we have in our index. For example, an image of a tiger might generate concepts like “feline,” “animal” or “big cat.” This lets us identify a picture by looking at its pixels, without needing to be told by the words on a page.</p><p>We’ve also made a number of updates to our most immersive experience for searching visual content, Google Images. These changes are aimed at helping people better find information visually, and making it easier to pursue the things people come to Google Images for help with, like shopping for products, styling a room, or tackling a DIY project.</p><p>Today, we’re introducing <a href="https://www.blog.google/products/search/improving-search-next-20-years">three fundamental shifts</a> in how we think about Search, including a range of new features that use AI to make your search experience more visual and enjoyable. And when you know you want to search visually, we’re making the Google Images experience even more useful and powerful.</p><p><b>Immersive visual content with stories</b></p><p>Earlier this year we worked with the AMP Project to announce <a href="https://developers.googleblog.com/2018/02/amp-stories-bringing-visual.html">AMP stories</a>, an open source library that makes it easy for anyone to create a story on the open web. While it’s still early, we’ve seen many publishers experimenting with this format and providing people with a more visual way to get information from Search and News. To help people discover these visual stories, we’ll also begin to show this content in Google Images and Discover.</p><p>Now we’re beginning to use AI to intelligently construct AMP stories and surface this content in Search. We’re starting today with stories about notable people—like celebrities and athletes—providing a glimpse into facts and important moments from their lives in a rich, visual format. This format lets you easily tap to the articles for more information and provides a new way to discover content from the web.</p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--medium h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--4 h-c-grid__col--offset-4 "><img alt="Giadastory" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/original_images/Very_Silver_3_fZ4dmcM.gif"/></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p><b>Visually preview topics with featured videos in Search</b></p><p>Videos can be a useful way to learn about a new topic, but it can be hard to find the most relevant videos to explore all the different facets of that topic space. Using computer vision, we’re now able to deeply understand the content of a video and help you quickly find the most useful information in a new experience called featured videos.</p><p>Imagine you’re planning a hiking trip to Zion National Park, and you want to check out videos of what to expect and ideas for sites to visit. Since you’ve never been there, you might not know which specific landmarks to look for when mapping out your trek.</p><p>With featured videos, we take our deep understanding of the topic space (in this case, the most important landmarks in the park) and show the most relevant videos for those subtopics. For Zion National Park, you might see a video for each attraction, like Angels Landing or the Narrows. This provides a more holistic view of the video content available for a topic, and opens up new paths to discover more.</p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--medium h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--4 h-c-grid__col--offset-4 "><img alt="Zion park" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/original_images/S20_Topic_Preview_Blog_Post_with_Frame_2Ek0AJS.gif"/></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><h2><b>Visual journeys with Google Images</b></h2><p>People coming to Google Images today are looking to find information, or for help doing something—not just to see an image. So we’re announcing several new features to help you find visual information more easily, and pursue activities where having a visual reference is important.</p><p><b>Tapping the power of the web page</b></p><p>When you come to Google Images for help on a task, the page where an image lives is important. Whatever page you visit should help you take the next step in what you’re trying to do. Also, with many visual searches, there may not be one right answer, so you want to scan a lot of images and information before you find what you need.</p><p>Over the last year, we’ve overhauled the Google Images algorithm to rank results that have both great images and great content on the page. For starters, the authority of a web page is now a more important signal in the ranking. If you’re doing a search for DIY shelving, the site behind the image is now more likely to be a site related to DIY projects. We also prioritize fresher content, so you’re more likely to visit a site that has been updated recently.</p><p>Also, it wasn’t long ago that if you visited an image’s web page, it might be hard to find the specific image you were looking for when you got there. We now prioritize sites where the image is central to the page, and higher up on the page. So if you’re looking to buy a specific pair of shoes, a product page dedicated to that pair of shoes will be prioritized above, say, a category page showing a range of shoe styles.  </p><p>Starting this week, we’ll also show more context around images, including captions that show you the title of the webpage where each image is published. This is critical to help you understand the page behind the image. We’ll also suggest related search terms at the top of the page for more guidance. We’ve already introduced this new look on mobile, and now we’re bringing it to desktop where a larger screen is important for complex tasks.</p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--large h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--6 h-c-grid__col--offset-3 "><img alt="desktop redesign" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/original_images/desktop_blog._OWIJKg1.gif"/></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p><b>Explore within an image using AI with Lens in Google Images</b></p><p>We <a href="https://www.blog.google/products/google-lens/google-lens-real-time-answers-questions-about-world-around-you/">launched</a> Google Lens last year to help you do more with what you see. People are already using it in their camera and on their photos—to find items in an outfit they like, learn more about landmarks, or identify that cute dog in the park. In the coming weeks, we’ll bring Lens to Google Images to help you explore and learn more about visual content you find during your searches.</p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--medium h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--4 h-c-grid__col--offset-4 "><img alt="lens gif" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/original_images/lens-blog.gif"/></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>Lens’ AI technology analyzes images and detects objects of interest within them. If you select one of these objects, Lens will show you relevant images, many of which link to product pages so you can continue your search or buy the item you’re interested in. Using your finger on a mobile device screen, Lens will also let you “draw” on any part of an image, even if it’s not preselected by Lens, to trigger related results and dive even deeper on what’s in your image.</p><p>We hope these changes will make it easier—and more visually interesting—to traverse the web, find information, and pursue your interests.</p><p><br/></p></div></div></body></html>

description: <html><head></head><body><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>Growing up in India, there was one good library in my town that I had access to—run by the British Council.  It was modest by western standards, and I had to take two buses just to get there. But I was lucky, because for every child like me, there were many more who didn’t have access to the same information that I did. Access to information changed my life, bringing me to the U.S. to study computer science and opening up huge possibilities for me that would not have been available without the education I had.  </p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--large h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--6 h-c-grid__col--offset-3 "><img alt="Ben's library" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/images/BLR_-_Koshys_1_1.max-1000x1000.jpg"/><figcaption class="article-image__caption "><div class="rich-text"><p>The British Council Library in my hometown.</p></div></figcaption></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>When Google started 20 years ago, our mission was to organize the world’s information and make it universally accessible and useful. That seemed like an incredibly ambitious mission at the time—even considering that in 1998 the web consisted of just 25 million pages (roughly the equivalent of books in a small library).</p><p>Fast forward to today, and now we index hundreds of billions of pages in our index—more information than all the libraries in the world could hold. We’ve grown to serve people all over the world, offering Search in more than 150 languages and over 190 countries.</p><p>Through all of this, we’ve remained grounded in our mission. In fact, providing greater access to information is as core to our work today as it was when we first started. And while almost everything has changed about technology and the information available to us, the core principles of Search have stayed the same.</p><ul><li><p>First and foremost, we <b>focus on the user</b>. Whether you’re looking for recipes, studying for an exam, or finding information on where to vote, we’re focused on serving your information needs.</p></li><li><p>We strive to give you the <b>most relevant, highest quality information</b> as quickly as possible. This was true when Google started with the Page Rank algorithm—the foundational technology to Search. And it’s just as true today.</p></li><li><p>We see billions of queries every day, and 15 percent of queries are ones we’ve never seen before. Given this scale, the only way to provide Search effectively is through an <b>algorithmic approach</b>. This helps us not just solve all the queries we’ve seen yesterday, but also all the ones we can’t anticipate for tomorrow.</p></li><li><p>Finally, we <b>rigorously test every change</b> we make. A key part of this testing is the <a href="https://static.googleusercontent.com/media/www.google.com/en//insidesearch/howsearchworks/assets/searchqualityevaluatorguidelines.pdf">rater guidelines</a> which define our goals in search, and which are publicly available for anyone to see. Every change to Search is evaluated by experimentation and by raters using these guidelines. Last year alone, we ran more than 200,000 experiments that resulted in 2,400+ changes to search. Search will serve you better today than it did yesterday, and even better tomorrow.</p></li></ul><br/><p>As Google marks our 20th anniversary, I wanted to share a first look at the next chapter of Search, and how we’re working to make information more accessible and useful for people everywhere. This next chapter is driven by three fundamental shifts in how we think about Search:</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.blog.google/products/search/helping-you-along-your-search-journeys">The shift from answers to journeys</a>: To help you resume tasks where you left off and learn new interests and hobbies, we’re bringing new features to Search that help you with ongoing information needs.</p></li><li><p><a href="https://www.blog.google/products/search/introducing-google-discover">The shift from queries to providing a queryless way to get to information</a>: We can surface relevant information related to your interests, even when you don’t have a specific query in mind.</p></li><li><p><a href="https://www.blog.google/products/search/making-visual-content-more-useful-search">And the shift from text to a more visual way of finding information</a>: We’re bringing more visual content to Search and completely redesigning Google Images to help you find information more easily.</p></li></ul><p>Underpinning each of these are our advancements in AI, improving our ability to understand language in ways that weren’t possible when Google first started. This is incredibly exciting, because over 20 years ago when I studied neural nets at school, they didn’t actually work very well...at all!</p><p>But we’ve now reached the point where neural networks can help us take a major leap forward from understanding words to understanding concepts. Neural embeddings, an approach developed in the field of neural networks, allow us to transform words to fuzzier representations of the underlying concepts, and then match the concepts in the query with the concepts in the document. We call this technique neural matching. This can enable us to address queries like: “why does my TV look strange?” to surface the most relevant results for that question, even if the exact words aren’t contained in the page. (By the way, it turns out the reason is called the <a href="https://www.google.com/search?q=soap+opera+effect">soap opera effect</a>).</p><p>Finding the right information about my TV is helpful in the moment. But AI can have much more profound effects. Whether it’s <a href="https://www.blog.google/products/search/helping-keep-people-safe-ai-enabled-flood-forecasting">predicting areas that might be affected in a flood</a>, or helping you identify <a href="https://www.blog.google/products/search/introducing-pathways-job-search/">the best job opportunities for you</a>, AI can dramatically improve our ability to make information more accessible and useful.</p><p>I’ve worked on Search at Google since the early days of its existence. One of the things that keeps me so inspired about Search all these years is our mission and how timeless it is. Providing greater access to information is fundamental to what we do, and there are always more ways we can help people access the information they need. That’s what pushes us forward to continue to make Search better for our users. And that’s why our work here is never done.</p></div></div></body></html>

description: <html><head></head><body><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>Last year we introduced <a href="https://www.blog.google/products/search/feed-your-need-know/">the Google feed</a> to surface relevant content to you, even when you’re not searching. It’s grown dramatically over the past year: more than 800 million people use the feed each month to stay up to date on their interests. Today—as a part of <a href="https://www.blog.google/products/search/improving-search-next-20-years">three fundamental shifts</a> in how we think about Search—we’re launching a major update to this experience, including a new name, a fresh look, and a brand-new set of features.</p><p></p><h3>A new name and look</h3><p>Since launching the feed, we’ve made it our goal to help you uncover fresh and interesting content about things that matter to you. Now, we’re giving the feed a name that reflects this mission: Discover. With this new name comes a fresh design that makes exploring your interests easier than ever.</p><p></p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--medium h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--4 h-c-grid__col--offset-4 "><img alt="Discover" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/original_images/discover_1x_30fps.gif"/></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>New topic headers explain why you’re seeing a particular card in Discover, and whenever a topic catches your eye, you can dive deeper to explore more on that topic.</p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--medium h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--4 h-c-grid__col--offset-4 "><img alt="Discover topic header" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/original_images/topicfeed_1x_30fps.gif.gif"/></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>Next to each topic name is a Discover icon, which you’ll also start to see in Search for an ever-growing set of topics. You can tap “Follow” to start seeing more about that topic in your experience.</p><h3>Evergreen content</h3><p>In addition to this new look, you’ll also see new types of content in Discover. You’ll find more videos and fresh visual content, as well as evergreen content—articles and videos that aren’t new to the web, but are new to you.</p><p><br/></p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><figure class="article-image--full article-module "><img alt="Discover new to you" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/original_images/nty_1.5x_30fps.gif"/></figure></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>For example, when you’re planning your next trip, Discover might show an article with the best places to eat or sights to see. Suddenly, a travel article published three months ago is timely for you. This can also be useful as you’re taking up a new hobby or going deeper on a long-time interest. Using the <a href="https://www.blog.google/products/search/helping-you-along-your-search-journeys">Topic Layer in the Knowledge Graph</a>, Discover can predict your level of expertise on a topic and help you further develop those interests. If you’re learning to play guitar, for example, you might see beginner content about learning chords. If you’re already a skilled musician, you may see a video on more advanced techniques.</p><br/><p>Discover is unique because it's one step ahead: it helps you come across the things you haven't even started looking for.</p></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><h3>More context and control</h3><p>Because Discover is all about you and your interests, there are now even more ways to customize what you see.</p><p><br/></p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--medium h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--4 h-c-grid__col--offset-4 "><img alt="Discover control icon" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/original_images/reactions_2x_30fps.gif"/></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>Just tap on the control icon to indicate that you want more or less content on that topic. You’ll continue to see content from a range of sources on any given topic, helping you explore new ideas surrounding your interests.</p><br/><p>When it comes to news, we believe it’s important that everyone has access to the same information. Discover uses the same technology as <a href="https://www.blog.google/products/news/new-google-news-ai-meets-human-intelligence/">Full Coverage in Google News</a> to bring you a variety of perspectives on the latest news.</p><br/><h3>Discover in multiple languages</h3><p>With this redesign, Discover will now be even more useful to people who speak multiple languages. You may like to use recipes in Spanish and read sports in English, and you will see content in your language of preference for each interest.</p><p><br/></p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--medium h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--4 h-c-grid__col--offset-4 "><img alt="Multilingual feed" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/images/bilingual2x.max-1000x1000.png"/></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>We’re starting with support for English and Spanish in the U.S. and will expand to more languages and countries soon.</p><br/><h3>Coming to google.com on your phone</h3><p>The Google homepage has always been a place to ask questions and search for information you’re interested in. Now, it will be even easier to keep up with your interests, because Discover is coming to google.com on all mobile browsers.</p><br/><p>Think of it as your new mobile homepage where you can not only search, but also discover useful, relevant information and inspiration from across the web for the topics you care about most. This will be rolling out over the next few weeks.</p><p><br/></p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--medium h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--4 h-c-grid__col--offset-4 "><img alt="Discover mobile homepage" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/images/tweed-hiking2x.max-1000x1000.png"/></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>We hope you find this refreshed experience helpful as you discover your next hobby and further develop your interests with Search.</p></div></div></body></html>

description: <html><head></head><body><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>Last year at I/O, we announced a new<a href="https://www.blog.google/products/search/connecting-more-americans-jobs/">job search</a> experience so more people can find jobs that meet their needs. Since then, we’ve continued to improve and expand this experience. We’ve already helped connect over 100 million people in 92 countries to job listings, and we’re working to bring this feature to more countries by the end of the year.</p><p>We’ve also focused on this unique challenge in individual communities. A few weeks ago, we shared our commitment to help our nation’s military service members transition to civilian jobs with <a href="https://www.blog.google/outreach-initiatives/grow-with-google/veteran-job-search/">job search for veterans</a>, a tool for service members to easily find civilian jobs that use the skills and experience they developed in their military roles.</p><p>But there’s more to be done. <a href="https://www.axios.com/americans-who-cant-afford-middle-class-basics-united-way-5da1e2e6-046b-4a53-9a11-1106a77564ef.html">Forty percent</a> of U.S. households struggle to afford ordinary expenses with their current income, while <a href="http://www.manpowergroup.us/campaigns/talent-shortage/">46 percent</a> of U.S. employers say they can't find employees with the skills they need. As industries change, a gap has formed in local communities: The skills in demand are not always the skills people have. And this gap is different in each community.  </p><p>We see an <a href="https://www.blog.google/products/search/improving-search-next-20-years">opportunity for Search</a> to help bridge this gap by connecting job seekers with effective, nearby job training programs delivering the skills local employers need. So that’s the challenge we’re working to solve now: to help people find useful information about the skills and training they need for a job, and better connect them with local resources that can help them realize those opportunities. Here’s one story that inspired us along the way:<br/></p></div></div><div class="block-video"><div class="h-c-page h-c-page--mobile-full-bleed"><div class="h-c-grid"><div class="h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col-l--12 "><div class="article-module article-video "><figure><a class="h-c-video h-c-video--marquee" data-glue-modal-disabled-on-mobile="true" data-glue-modal-trigger="uni-modal-1s72jnZ-XFA-" href="https://youtube.com/watch?v=1s72jnZ-XFA"><img alt="Introducing Pathways, an initiative to connect Americans to local training programs" src="//img.youtube.com/vi/1s72jnZ-XFA/maxresdefault.jpg"/><svg class="h-c-video__play h-c-icon h-c-icon--color-white" role="img"><use xlink:href="#mi-youtube-icon"></use></svg></a></figure></div></div></div></div><div class="h-c-modal--video" data-glue-modal="uni-modal-1s72jnZ-XFA-" data-glue-modal-close-label="Close Dialog"><a class="glue-yt-video" data-glue-yt-video-autoplay="true" data-glue-yt-video-height="99%" data-glue-yt-video-vid="1s72jnZ-XFA" data-glue-yt-video-width="100%" href="https://youtube.com/watch?v=1s72jnZ-XFA" ng-cloak=""></a></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>We want to help create more stories like Aaron’s for people everywhere and believe these opportunities should be more discoverable online. That’s why today we’re announcing a new feature within job search called Pathways—part of our <a href="https://grow.google/">Grow with Google</a>initiative to ensure economic opportunity for everyone.</p><p>Here’s our aspiration for how this will work: When someone searches for jobs on Google, we’ll show not only jobs available right now in their area, but also information about effective local training and education programs.  </p><p>We’re starting a pilot of Pathways in Virginia, where we’re partnering with leading organizations in this ecosystem including the State of Virginia, the Virginia Community College System, local employers, and many others to make these local programs more discoverable through Search.</p><p>We’re also piloting with Goodwill, the leading nonprofit job training provider in the U.S. As part of our Pathways initiative, volunteer Google engineers will work with local Goodwill organizations to ensure their education and training programs are easily found on the open web.</p><p>What we learn from these pilots will help us develop new features and ensure information about programs are readily accessible to everyone in the U.S., and more countries in the future. We want to enable communities to thrive, and make transitions like Aaron’s possible everywhere.</p>If your organization wants to collaborate and work together to bring this experience to life, <a href="https://services.google.com/fb/forms/growwithgoogle-contactus/">join us</a>.</div></div></body></html>

description: <html><head></head><body><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>We’ve spent the last 20 years optimizing Search so it works really well for getting quick information. You ask what the capital of Costa Rica is, and we’ll tell you it’s San José. But in life we often take longer journeys, and people turn to Search for help in these moments too.</p><p>Many searches are related to longer sessions that span multiple days, with people coming back to Search to find the latest updates on a topic or explore the range of content available. For example, you might be planning a trip, and searching for information about a destination over the course of a month. Or perhaps you regularly search for “easy dinner recipes” to help you plan you meals for the week.</p><p>We can do better to help in these journeys, so today we’re sharing new features that help you resume tasks where you left off, keep track of ideas and content that you found useful, and get relevant suggestions of things to explore next. All of this marks a <a href="https://www.blog.google/products/search/improving-search-next-20-years">fundamental transformation</a> in the way Search understands interests and longer journeys to help you find information.</p><h3>Retrace your steps with activity cards</h3><p>Retracing your steps online can be really difficult. While we’ve always made your Search history available in your account settings, you should be able to access it when you’re searching, so it can be useful to you in the moment.</p>Now, a new activity card will help you pick up from where you left off in Search. When you revisit a query related to a task you've started in the past, we’ll show you a card with relevant pages you’ve already visited and previous queries you’ve done on this topic. This helps you retrace your steps when you might not remember which sites had that useful information you’d found earlier.</div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--medium h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--4 h-c-grid__col--offset-4 "><img alt="activity card" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/images/pasted_image_0_1_P41DA8u.max-1000x1000.png"/></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>We’re intelligently showing this card only when it’s useful; it won’t appear for every search. And you’ll have full control over it—you can easily remove results from your history, pause seeing this card, or choose not to see it all together. This new activity card will be available in Search later this year.</p><h3>Keep track of your searches with Collections</h3><p>Another way to more easily navigate long search journeys is by adding useful content to Collections. Collections in Search help you keep track of content you’ve visited, such as a website or article or image, and quickly get back to it later.</p><p>Now, with an improved Collections experience, you can add your content from an activity card directly to Collections. This makes it even easier to keep track of and organize the content you want to revisit.</p><p><br/></p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--large h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--6 h-c-grid__col--offset-3 "><img alt="Collections" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/images/Collections_Composite.max-1000x1000.png"/></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>We’ve also added content suggestions to help you explore topics further, based on the other content you’ve saved and things you’ve searched for. We’ll start rolling out this new Collections experience later this fall.</p><h3>Dynamic organization of Search results</h3><p>Every search journey is different, and especially if you’re not familiar with the topic, it’s not always clear what your next search should be to help you learn more. So we’re introducing a new way of dynamically organizing search results that helps you more easily determine what information to explore next.</p><p>Rather than presenting information within a set of predetermined categories, we can intelligently show the subtopics that are most relevant to what you’re searching for and make it easy to explore information from the web, all with a single search.</p><p>So if you’re searching for Pugs, for example, you’ll now be able to see the tabs for the most common and relevant subtopics, like breed characteristics and names, right at the top. But if you search for something else, even a different kind of dog, like Yorkshire Terriers, you’ll see options grooming tips and breed history.</p><p><br/></p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--large h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--6 h-c-grid__col--offset-3 "><img alt="Dynamically organized results" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/images/Dogs_composite.max-1000x1000.png"/></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>The best part about this feature is that it continues to stay fresh and learns over time. As new information is published to the web, these tabs stay up to date to reflect what’s most relevant to that topic. This dynamic page organization is already live for a variety of topics, and we’ll expand to more in the future.</p><h3>A new Topic Layer in the Knowledge Graph</h3><p>To enable all of these updates, Search has to understand interests and how they progress over time. So we’ve taken our existing Knowledge Graph—which understands connections between people, places, things and facts about them—and added a new layer, called the Topic Layer, engineered to deeply understand a topic space and how interests can develop over time as familiarity and expertise grow.</p><p>The Topic Layer is built by analyzing all the content that exists on the web for a given topic and develops hundreds and thousands of subtopics. For these subtopics, we can identify the most relevant articles and videos—the ones that have shown themselves to be evergreen and continually useful, as well as fresh content on the topic. We then look at patterns to understand how these subtopics relate to each other, so we can more intelligently surface the type of content you might want to explore next.</p><p>All of this enables experiences that make it easier than ever to explore your interests, <a href="https://www.blog.google/products/search/introducing-google-discover">even if you don’t have your next search in mind</a>. We’re excited for the potential of this technology to provide more opportunities for discovery and exploration in Search.</p><p><br/></p></div></div></body></html>

description: <html><head></head><body><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>For nearly two decades, people around the world have used Google to find answers, communicate, build businesses, and more. Our users have long entrusted us to be responsible with their data and we take that trust and responsibility very seriously.</p><p>Our investment in privacy and security is evident in every product we build, including the powerful tools we provide to help our users make decisions about their data like the <a href="https://myaccount.google.com/intro/privacycheckup">Privacy Checkup</a>. Google products and features cannot launch until they are approved by the specialists in our Privacy and Data Protection Office, which solicits input from across Google, as well as periodically from users and experts worldwide. And our broad commitment to transparency is evident in our newly-refreshed <a href="https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en&amp;gl=ZZ">Privacy Policy</a>, which includes informative videos that explain our practices and settings, as well as tools like <a href="https://myactivity.google.com/">My Activity</a> that provide detailed information about the data in a user’s Google Account and options for how to control it. <a href="https://googleblog.blogspot.com/2010/04/greater-transparency-around-government.html">Since 2010</a>, our <a href="https://transparencyreport.google.com/?hl=en">Transparency Report</a> has provided information on how the policies and actions of governments and corporations affect privacy, security, and access to information.</p><p>I’m proud of the work we do at Google. That’s why, after almost a decade leading Google's privacy legal team, I've recently agreed to take on the role of Chief Privacy Officer. In this role, I set the priorities for the privacy program at Google, including continually challenging ourselves to make sure our privacy and security tools, policies, and practices are as user-focused as every other aspect of our business. My team’s goal is to help you enjoy the benefits of technology, while remaining in control of your privacy.</p><p>This is an important time to take on this new role. Now, more than any other time I have worked in this field, there is real momentum to develop baseline rules of the road for data protection. Google welcomes this and supports comprehensive, baseline privacy regulation. People deserve to feel comfortable that all entities that use personal information will be held accountable for protecting it. And we believe that regulation can support a dynamic marketplace for businesses of all types and sizes.</p><p>Today, we’re sharing our view on the requirements, scope, and enforcement expectations that should be reflected in all responsible data protection laws. This framework is based on established privacy frameworks, as well as our experience providing services that rely on personal data and our work to comply with evolving data protection laws around the world. These principles help us evaluate new legislative proposals and advocate for responsible, interoperable and adaptable data protection regulations. How these principles are put into practice will shape the nature and direction of innovation. You can find more detail in <a href="https://services.google.com/fh/files/blogs/google_framework_responsible_data_protection_regulation.pdf">this PDF</a>.</p><p>Sound practices combined with strong and balanced regulations can help provide individuals with confidence that they’re in control of their personal information. I look forward to discussing these principles and Google’s work on privacy and security with the U.S. Senate later this week, and to working with policymakers and all stakeholders on regulation that protects consumers and enables innovation.</p><p><br/></p></div></div></body></html>

description: <p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">编者按：上周的苹果发布会大家最关注的当然是新款的iPhone手机。但是在分析师Horace Dediu看来，那次发布会上最重要的声明是苹果副总裁Lisa Jackson给苹果制订的新目标：消除需要从地球开采新材料的需要。为了实现这一点，苹果将尽可能延长产品的寿命。这跟恨不得大家天天换手机的做法很不一样，也会被投资者视为会减少苹果收入的下策。但Dediu不这么看，实际上他认为<a href="http://www.asymco.com/2018/09/13/lasts-longer/" target="_blank">恰恰相反</a>。</span></p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/17152841/6ltp2xsq95rthidk.jpg!heading" data-img-size-val="1600,900"/></p><blockquote><p><span style="background-color: #F8F8FA; font-family: &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Open Sans&quot;, Arial, &quot;Hiragino Sans GB&quot;, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeiti, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, SimSun, sans-serif;">苹果作为一家公司其目的是创造并维系客户以及创造和维系产品。这是苹果的根本，但没有得到充分认识。</span></p></blockquote><p>Lisa Jackson在2018年9月的iPhone发布会上所做的演示，我认为也许是最有趣，也是意义最深远的一次。</p><p>Lisa Jackson是苹果的副总裁，负责环境、政策与社会行动。此前，Jackson女士担任过美国环境保护署的署长。她在苹果的角色负责的是负责让苹果的全部设施过渡到100%使用可再生能源。</p><p>这个目标已经实现，这是一项了不起的成就，值得祝贺一下。但她的演讲有一项新目标值得注意。</p><p>她为苹果制订了一个新目标，消除需要从地球开采新材料的需要。</p><p>她说为了达到这一目标，苹果需要做三件事情：</p><ol style="list-style-type: decimal;" class=" list-paddingleft-2"><li><p>一切产品均采用可回收或可再生材料</p></li><li><p>确保苹果产品寿命尽可能延长</p></li><li><p>经过长时间使用之后，确保产品能够恰当地回收。</p></li></ol><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/17150510/szlt44rdxmaozmyu.png!heading" data-img-size-val="620,348"/></p><p>我认为可博得满堂彩的是第二点。<br/></p><p>为了强调第二点，她说苹果现在正在努力设计和开发耐用的产品，要尽可能延长产品寿命。这意味着持续时间很长的硬件和软件。她指出iOS 12甚至还能在推出iPhone 5S上面跑，现在都有5年了。因为iPhone撑得越久，你就可以不断使用或者升级后交给另一个人让后者继续使用。</p><p>她说“让iPhone继续用下去”是对这个地球最好的一件事。</p><p>演讲到这个时候我不禁在想每个人会不会冲出去告诉经纪人把苹果的股票给卖了。投资耐用商品硬件公司的前提之一是其股价取决于升级的频次。如果产品不能够频繁替换的话，也就不能产生收入，而卖这些产品的公司随着市场饱和最终就会增长很慢（如果有增长的话）。智能手机也当然正在朝着饱和的方向发展，让苹果产品更耐久的潜台词就是意味着来自替换的收入更低。这种围绕着替换率和延长寿命的焦虑被分析师用来给未来的现金流打折扣，如果那些预期寿命延长的话目标股价就会下降。</p><p>那么为什么苹果还要这么做？聚焦耐用性作为商业模式的逻辑在哪里？这对环境也许有好处但对财务有好处吗？</p><p>当然，如果环境恶化的话就没有什么生意可做了，而且我们都应该努力实现可持续性。但这是一种存在主义的观察，是防御性的。最重要的一点是苹果在赌可持续性是成长性业务。</p><p>基本上，苹果在赌拥有客户而不是卖给他们产品。</p><p>苹果作为一家公司的目标是创造和维系客户以及创造和维系产品。这是苹果的根本，但并没有得到充分认识。</p><p>要想理解这其中的机制，不妨看看下面这张定价图，你可以把它当做一个在市场份额下降的情况下提价的故事。但如果你理解产品的每一项进展都增加了可吸收的效用的话，则每用户成本仍然保持稳定或者还有下降。</p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/17150532/rnb4amd3j8z8gbhq.png!heading" data-img-size-val="613,620"/></p><p>1200美元的iPhone可能还没有600美元的iPhone贵，如果1200美元的版本耐用1倍而且每天多使用1倍的话。也就是说1200美元的手机以2倍价格带来了4倍的功用，这使得价格相当于减半。通过制造更耐用的产品，这种耐用性既包括硬件也包括软件，其客户群将会感到满意并且留存下来。</p><p>实际上，原先的买家可能会转售iPhone而那台2手的设备可能还会被再次转售。这意味着一台iPhone在生命周期之内可以有3位用户，因此可能最终会将苹果的受众扩大2甚至3倍。</p><p>提供给扩大的受众的可以有可穿戴设备以及服务等附件与附加产品。这些残留商业模式肯定是赚钱的，甚至比iPhone还要赚钱。</p><p>苹果在用的设备数量达到了13亿，用户可能高达10亿。这个规模肯定还要扩大而且在耐用的设备和软件的帮助下还会扩大得更加迅速。</p><p>这种硬件即平台与硬件即订阅的模式是其他任何硬件公司都无法匹敌的。这不仅是高度负责，而且也是高度可防御的模式，因此是很棒的业务。有计划地报废是糟糕业务，防御性不强。</p><p>因此，苹果宣布现在优先考虑延长设备和软件的寿命是非常重要的，我认为这是2018年iPhone发布会上最重要的一项声明。</p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">原文链接：<a href="http://www.asymco.com/2018/09/13/lasts-longer/" _src="http://www.asymco.com/2018/09/13/lasts-longer/">http://www.asymco.com/2018/09/13/lasts-longer/</a></span></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;"> description: <p>据外媒报道，英国金融科技公司 Cleo 近日完成 1000 万美元 A 轮融资，领投方为一家欧洲风险投资公司，曾投资过独角兽公司 Revolut 和 GoCardless，老股东也参与了跟投。有消息称，A轮融资后，Cleo 的投后估值达到 3000 万英镑（合3970万美元）。</p><p>Cleo 是英国的一家 Fintech 公司，当它的产品“财务聊天机器人”悄悄进入美国市场的时候，很多人并没有注意，毕竟太多财力雄厚的英国初创公司都“入美失败”。然而，短短4个月时间，Cleo的用户就突破了 35 万人，并称在英国、美国和加拿大地区有超过 60 万名用户，新用户保持每周 3 万名的增长速度。这些都引起了投资人的关注。</p><p>此前，Cleo 已经得到了伦敦科技界几家最大的风投公司大佬的<a href="https://36kr.com/p/5085433.html" target="_blank">支持</a>，包括 Entrepreneur First、月果的联合创始人 Wendy Tan White、 Joe White,、Skype 的创始人 Niklas Zennström、Wonga 的创始人 Errol Damelin、TransferWise 的创始人 Taavet Hinrikus 和 LocalGlobe，这个名单还在增加。</p><p>联合创始人兼 CEO&nbsp;Barney Hussey-Yeo表示，融资将用于继续扩大公司的规模，以及进一步国际扩张。Hussey-Yeo称，因为Cleo 竞标成为了千禧一代进行资金管理和互动的“默认界面”，因此 Cleo 将针对西欧、美洲和澳大拉西亚发布，有望在未来 12 个月内进入 22 个国家。</p><p>Cleo 通过 Facebook Messenger 即可访问，人工智能聊天机器人能帮你了解多个账户和信用卡的开支情况，可以按交易、类别或商家分类。此外，根据收集的财务数据，用户可以进行财务管理，比如选择把钱存起来以备不时之需，或者设定一个特定的目标，亦或是基于Facebook Messenger 转账、捐给慈善机构、设置消费提示等等。</p><p>Hussey-Yeo 表示，不需要成为一家银行来完成用户与财务的交互，作为非银行机构，也没有执照、资本监管和负担，公司可以更快地扩张。“我有一种感觉，这种策略的利弊，都有很长的路要走。”</p>
title: 用AI机器人接管你的银行App，英国金融科技公司Cleo完成千万美元A轮融资

description: <p>据外媒报道，美国FDA(食品药品监督管理局)希望电子烟制造商能限制儿童吸烟，该机构正在考虑一套快速跟踪审查一些特征，能够让未成年人更难使用电子烟设备。</p><p>据了解，这些特种可能包括蓝牙功能，它可以有效地将学校作为禁烟区进行隔离，并将生物特征电子香烟锁定在特定用户身上，这样孩子们就不能“借用”他们父母的电子烟。</p><p>如果该特征追踪大规模推广，那在学校点燃一根电子烟就会特别费劲了，难度系数可能要超过开枪。生产具有指纹锁或其他认证机制的智能枪，会遇到不小的阻力，尤其是来自枪支使用者的阻碍，他们担心这种技术在紧急情况下可能会非常不可靠，而且一旦有智能武器，传统枪支就可能被淘汰。据彭博社报道，美国枪支制造商史密斯&amp;威森公司（Smith &amp; Wesson）本月向 SEC 提交的文件中称，该公司不投资于智能枪技术的研究，因为它不相信消费者会买单。</p><p>FDA 上周已经和几家电子烟巨头沟通，包括 JUUL、VUSE（英美烟草公司旗下）、MarkTen（Philip&nbsp; Morris American Port Altra 旗下）、BLU-ECIGS（来自英国烟草巨头帝国品牌）和Logic（日本烟草品牌），要求他们在60天之内拟出一份计划，以防止儿童和青少年使用电子烟。</p><p>FDA 发言人 Scott Gottlieb 在一份声明中说：“年轻人不该使用含尼古丁的产品。有证据表明，很多儿童是尼古丁的常客。”</p><p>FDA 计划在网上给孩子们做广告，警告他们吸烟的危险性，并在高中发布宣传海报。它还和警告和罚款那些向未成年用户出售电子香烟的零售商，并警告制造商可能需要从市场上下架一些孩子可能会喜欢的口味。</p><p>电子烟公司&nbsp;JUUL 是最受欢迎的未成年用户的品牌之一，他表示，Juul 的电子香烟是用来帮助成人吸烟者戒烟的。该公司已经宣布了支持蓝牙设备的计划，可以帮助用户跟踪他们消耗了多少尼古丁，并要求用户定期核实他们的年龄来继续使用电子烟。</p><p>国产电子烟，36氪曾报道过<a href="https://36kr.com/p/5143922.html" target="_blank">Gippro</a>（龙舞）、<a href="https://36kr.com/p/5140199.html" target="_blank">RELX悦刻</a>。</p>
title: 枪无法智能，但电子烟可以

description: <p>编者按：科技公司的“零成本”模型越来越超越传统经济学的范畴了，我们该怎么理解“零成本”商业模型的边界，未来会是什么样子。希望TNW的这篇文章能够你带来一些启发。<br/><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24021733/3zyq6rpel06ry40b.png!heading" data-img-size-val="796,417"/></p><p>1776年，亚当史密斯写《富国论》的时候应该预想不到，有一天世界上最大的公司们竟然免费送出大量的服务。但是，这正是今天数字经济中正在发生的。<br/></p><p>当基于金钱的传统经济体逐渐转向追求免费APP的数字文化的同时，获取越来越多服务的成本逐步趋于零；公司们要换取的不再是美元欧元，而是人们的注意力——和数据。</p><h3 label="二级标题">新经济模式</h3><p>“零成本”模型和工业时代以来的经济模型渐行渐远，传统的市场成功指标开始不适用于今天。比如，当供给不再基于美元而基于人类行为的时候，GDP和通货膨胀率这些指标开始失去意义。</p><p>获取每一个新用户的便捷成本趋于零时，公司就有选择直接将价格降为零从而获取尽可能多的市场注意力和用户时间。</p><p>当注意力足够高时，它就可以被变现。除了卖广告之外，公司也可以将用户数据变现。结果就是，我们回到了一种以物换物的体系，不过不是用公鸡换玉米，而是信息换数据。</p><h3 label="二级标题">行为驱动经济</h3><p>价格趋于零的模型对于现代经济来说并非全新，电视节目也是类似的一个例子。但现在不同的是，这种新模式渗入我们生活的程度。从电视到电脑再到移动手机，一个人几乎全部的生活行为都可以被记载。<br/></p><p>虽然从用户角度看，免费服务几乎可以被简单地理解为共赢，但实际上公司们从用户身上攫取的东西比我们以为的要多。当用户行为数据变得更为值钱，企业开始学习利用心理学的方法使人们沉迷在他们的网站、APP和游戏上。</p><p>Sean Parker 作为 Facebook 的早期投资人曾表示，社交媒体本身的设计就是为了鼓励人们沉迷于令人上瘾的行为、并且让用户陷入习惯养成的社交反馈循环中。<span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">这种做法引发的结果就是，大量人群对检查社交媒体更新、游戏进度和其他app消息产生上瘾。</span></p><h3 label="二级标题"><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">“零成本”模型催生的科技巨头垄断</span></h3><p>上述结论不仅扭曲了我们对传统经济学理论的认知，而且也挑战了我们对垄断概念的理解。这个时代的垄断基于注意力。</p><p>建立在免费和上瘾原则之上的科技巨头，例如Facebook、Apple 和 Google，使其他人进入这个市场变得非常艰难。垄断地位使他们获得大量资源，从而可以买下任何可能占据用户大量时间的竞争者。</p><p>传统意义上，经济学家认为垄断危险是因为它对消费者有害。垄断企业对价格具有绝对控制权，以至于消费者没法衡量价格的合理性。因此，政府通常需要对这样的垄断采取阻止行动。</p><p>新型垄断的不同在于，科技巨头正在向用户提供尽可能低价的服务。</p><p>只不过，低价服务换取的行为数据可以被用来变现，而这些变现的方式在全世界各地都面临较少的监管。</p><h3 label="二级标题">新现实的未来</h3><p>建立个人身份意识的方式正在面临重大变革。</p><p>过去几个世纪，人们依赖物质主义的基础建立身份意识。在“零成本”模型愈发渗入我们生活的时候，物质主义扮演的角色越来越小。</p><p>向外界传递身份信息最主要的方式是，我们选择在哪里消费自己的注意力和时间——而不是我们拥有什么。新的群组划分将不是基于我们追随哪些品牌或者使用什么产品，而会基于我们在哪些线上平台或者社交媒体活动。</p><p>以Instagram、Snapchat 和 Reddit 为例，每个平台都宣称自己拥有一个强大忠诚的社区；但同时，每个社区都非常骄傲地让自己和其他社区有明显的区分。</p><p>最终，当注意力经济成为社会最强大的推动力，我们表达自己的方式也终将和今天不同。</p>
title: “免费科技”经济会制造有害的垄断和改变我们的自我表达方式

description: <p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201809/24143942/bkpf9oek513x7urb.png!heading" data-img-size-val="720,432" width="720"/></p><p>智能音响层出不穷的年份，猫王收音机上个月发布了新品“旅行者2号”，在小众音响的路上越走越专注。<span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">与太平洋两岸各大科技巨头的音响比起来，猫王选择了未来感的反面——它显然极具复古色彩。</span></p><p><span style="font-family:PingFang SC, Lantinghei SC, Helvetica Neue, Helvetica, Arial, Microsoft YaHei, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, WenQuanYi Zen Hei, WenQuanYi Micro Hei, sans-serif">但是复古风格也只是猫王作为一家音响公司商业策略的表现，<strong>这篇文章在褪去了品牌活动的喧嚣之后，想分享两个观察。它们都是小众消费品牌在音乐内容巨头林立的市场中，站稳小众市场的有趣尝试。</strong></span></p><h3 label="二级标题">像用 Kindle 一样用猫王</h3><p>这并不是发布会上猫王对自己产品的理解，而是我在使用过程中产生了这种感受。<br/></p><p>在完成了收音机设置之后，我再听音乐时，只需要转动按钮即可。<span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">不需要打开手机连蓝牙、不需要打开音乐APP、不需要选择歌曲。还有，在听歌过程中，可供我操作的交互方式只限于音箱上的3个旋钮。</span></p><p>这意味着，我可以在手机不在手中的时候完成听音乐这件事情；而手机不在手则意味着，我减少了一键打开其他APP的几率，提高了我更纯粹欣赏音乐的可能。</p><p>这就好比在尝试了使用手机和Kindle读电子书后，我更倾向于使用Kindle。除了屏幕对眼睛更加友好之外，Kindle有限的功能可以大大提高阅读的效率和体验。</p><p>猫王如此的设计在一定程度上模拟了Kindle对阅读的作用。</p><p>只是有一点，阅读本身就是一件需要占据用户主要精力的事情，但是听音乐对很多人来说是其他行为的背景活动。所以，针对这一点，猫王延伸出了软件和内容，试图把听音乐听电台本身也变成特定用户的主要行为。</p><h3 label="二级标题">为精神消费升级所做的内容创新</h3><p>发布会上，猫王举了一个自制电台的例子：<br/></p><p>以往很多人在听披头士的一首歌时，可能会或者可能不会注意到歌曲开端的一些音响回授；但是猫王邀请了知名电台主播为听众讲解音乐，这样用户可以在主播的介绍下，不仅听了音乐，而能够逐渐成为更了解音乐历史和真正懂得音乐的人。</p><p>在消费升级的大潮下，猫王认为这是用户精神层面的消费升级。</p><p>在用户原本“热爱音乐”的生活方式基础上，为其带去更多知识和认知层面的提升；让音乐旅行变得有人陪伴和人格化，猫王的自制电台节目正是在试图重新理解和探索其小众用户的需求。<br/></p><p>我在年中对<a href="https://36kr.com/p/5139304.html" target="_blank">教育行业复盘</a>的一篇文章中，提及了教育类产品边界的逐渐模糊：</p><address><p>他们能够照顾到用户在经历人生某个特殊阶段时的情绪变化、能够照顾到用户在身体力行地实践某些新知识时候的担忧和不安……能够理解他们希望从大量弱关系中发展处强关系的需求。</p><p>从用户需求出发，带有教育、社交和陪伴式属性的垂直领域产品会越来越多。它不是为了满足所谓“接受教育”的需求，而是为了满足上述的、复杂的现代人需求。</p></address><p>某种程度上，猫王来自传统教育行业外，但是却带有一些“传递知识”的属性，这本身就是音乐、教育和消费升级这些概念相互交融和边界模糊的表现。</p><p><br/></p><p><br/></p><p><br/></p><p><br/></p>
title: 从硬件到内容，猫王收音机升级小众人群生活方式的新尝试

description: <html><head></head><body><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>Around 75,000 years ago (give or take a couple of millennia), a supervolcano erupted on the island of Sumatra in Indonesia, throwing out so much ash that it created a volcanic winter lasting several years. The eruption was so massive that the volcano collapsed under its own power, creating the caldera we now call Lake Toba.</p><br/><p>At over 100 kilometers long and 30 kilometres wide, Lake Toba is the largest volcanic lake in the world. A small team of Googlers spent the last two months scouring every meter of its coastline, using a Street View Trekker mounted on a boat,  to collect gorgeous 360-degree imagery around this former supervolcano.</p><br/><p>It may have been a fiery pit of lava in the distant past, but today, Lake Toba is a lush Indonesian rainforest, home to an abundance of native animals like orangutans and tapirs. We weren’t able to catch any of these creatures in the imagery, but we did get a lot of other natural attractions.</p></div></div><div class="block-image_carousel"><div class="h-c-page See if you can spot any on Street View!</i></p></div></figcaption></figure></li></ul><div class="h-c-carousel__paginate glue-pagination-previous" data-glue-pagination-label="Previous" data-glue-pagination-update-model="false"><div class="h-c-carousel__paginate-wrap"><svg class="h-c-icon h-c-icon--keyboard-arrow-left" role="img"><use xlink:href="#mi-keyboard-arrow-right"></use></svg></div></div><div class="h-c-carousel__paginate glue-pagination-next" data-glue-pagination-label="Next" data-glue-pagination-update-model="false"><div class="h-c-carousel__paginate-wrap"><svg class="h-c-icon h-c-icon--keyboard-arrow-right" role="img"><use xlink:href="#mi-keyboard-arrow-right"></use></svg></div></div></div><div class="h-c-carousel__navigation"><div class="glue-pagination-page-list"></div></div></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>Lake Toba looms large in the imagination of the Batak, the people who have inhabited the area for centuries. According to Batak legend, a fisherman caught a fish that turned into a beautiful princess. She married him on the condition that he never reveal her true origin. One day, in a fit of impatience at their son, the fisherman called him a son of a fish. When the princess heard her husband had broken his oath, she told her son to climb to the highest peak in the area. She prayed and it began to rain so hard that the resulting flood created a huge lake. The peak, which her son was on became the island of Samosir, revered by the Batak in the area as their original home. The princess? She went back to being a fish!</p><br/>Today we invite you to explore Lake Toba, now part of our Street View collection of other amazing places in Indonesia like <a href="https://www.google.co.uk/intl/en/streetview/#pt-taman-wisata-candi-borobudur-prambanan-ratu-boko/borobudur-temple-1">Borobudur</a> and the sites for the <a href="https://www.google.com/streetview/#asian-games-2018/gelora-sriwijaya-stadium-jsc">2018 Asian Games</a>.</div></div></body></html>
